doc:
Candela Peña https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Candela_Pe%C3%B1a 0 María del Pilar Peña Sánchez (born 14 July 1973), better known as Candela Peña, is a Spanish actress.She is the only child of a couple who had a bar in Barcelona. When she was four years old she started to learn dance in the city and after finishing high-school she went to Seville to begin theatre classes there and eventually in Madrid. Encouraged by Pedro Almodóvar, she published the novel Pérez Príncipe, María Dolores in 2001. She won the Goya Award in 2003 (for the movie Te doy mis ojos) after being nominated several times previously. María_del_Pilar_Peña_Sánchez ( born 14_July_1973 ) , better_known as Candela_Peña , is a_Spanish_actress.She is the_only_child of a_couple who had a_bar in Barcelona . When she was four_years old she started_to_learn dance in the_city and after finishing high-school she went to Seville to_begin theatre_classes there_and_eventually in Madrid . Encouraged by Pedro_Almodóvar , she published the_novel_Pérez_Príncipe , María_Dolores in 2001 . She won the_Goya_Award in 2003_( for the_movie_Te_doy_mis_ojos ) after being_nominated several_times previously .
